author: Innovatio
title: Crowdfunding Website for Proposals
description: Catalyst funding levels are not sufficient to guarantee successful implementation of a medium-large projects. They need follow-on funding.

assessments.note: This is an interesting proposal. It is not clear this proposal meets the objectives of this fund. It is not focused on the developer ecosystem.
assessments.reply: In the development of the proposal it has been clarified in which points of the challenge works, in fact it is specified in the attached documents and you can see it in real time on the discord channel, for which we consider that we fit perfectly with the purposes of the fund. We help entrepreneurs and developers to adopt blockchain technology, specifically that of cardano.

assessments.note: Crowdfunding is an excellent idea. It would provide a secondary funding vehicle outside of catalyst. It could help build revenue options for both startups and Cardano enthusiasts. Motivated investors could help improve products and drive overall Cardano ecosystem exposure through various marketing strategies.
Doesn't address growing number of developers on Cardano, just provides an alternate way for project financing
assessments.reply: In the development of the proposal it has been clarified in which points of the challenge works, in fact it is specified in the attached documents and you can see it in real time on the discord channel, for which we consider that we fit perfectly with the purposes of the fund. We help entrepreneurs and developers to adopt blockchain technology, specifically that of cardano. And we do not necessarily have to increase the number of developers, which also goes with our objectives, but we also provide an environment for "A sense of community and conversations. Having people around to talk with."

assessments.note: The proposal provides crypto holders to crowd-fund ideas and startups, bringing better returns to their capital. This is likely to provide better utilization and circulation of crypto and also attract new innovators to crypto.

First off, I really like this project. I gave you five stars all the way through because you have been very thorough IF YOU FIND all the attached documents and look through them... My only real criticism is that I am afraid there are going to be people that miss some of your documentation because it wasn't linked directly in the main proposal. I did notice the bold type that tells everyone to look at the attached documents but I (and I have been looking at a lot of proposals) did not know you could add extra docs at the end WITHOUT THEM SHOWING UP in a more pronounced way under the additional documents. 

Other then that, I think your proposal does directly address the challenge. You covered almost all the angles (I did not see a section for challenges but I am going to give you a pass for that based on your overall proposal). 

There is going to be a crowdfunding Cardano App. I have seen many proposals for this but yours stands out as the best I have seen so far. Great Work!
The team has the skills to deliver something here, though this is a complex undertaking.

It appears the benefits for investing are reward based,... like Kickstarter.  In the U.S. equity based options are now available to most investors. Future equity based reward opportunities could take market share away form rewards based options. Adding an equity licensing options to the roadmap could possibly drive interest and votes.    

Additional background information/options for U.S. companies: 
U.S. Securities-based Crowdfunding Under Title III of the JOBS Act , Feb. 28, 2017By: Vladimir Ivanov and Anzhela Knyazeva
Abstract:
"Title III of the JOBS Act created a new exemption from registration for Internet-based securities offerings of up to $1 million over a 12-month period.  The SEC adopted securities-based crowdfunding rules on October 30, 2015.  Issuers were able to use the new exemption beginning May 16, 2016, when the final rules became effective.  Below we present initial evidence on the offering activity in the Title III crowdfunding market for offerings initiated during May 16, 2016-December 31, 2016."
Link:
https://www.sec.gov/dera/staff-papers/white-papers/28feb17_ivanov-knyazeva_crowdfunding-under-titleiii-jobs-act.html#.YJnr4rdZZ1I.mailto
assessments.reply:
The person has not read our expansion proposal for the next two years, which is to adopt the debt and equity category.
I understand that you have not taken into account the great difference of a platform that operates with smart contracts and cryptocurrencies and a platform that operates with fiat currencies only.
As we have explained previously, including debt and equity has a totally different legal section. The equity category could be resolved with ICOs, but it is an issue to be resolved when the platform is in its final stages, since they are different licenses than donation and rewards. Also, the company will be register on Estonia, European Union, not USA.

assessments.note: The people seem to have experience but the asking amount of funding is way too much for this kind of project
assessments.reply:
I do not see any objective criticism to receive such a rating, is there any metric or rule that prohibits requesting such an amount of funds?
Furthermore, the amount of funds requested is broken down in the budget breakdown of the attached documents, it is specified for which every cent will be used, even having a work team charging less than what any DEV would charge in a freelancer job. It is a platform with around 3000 hours of development.

assessments.note: The proposing group has a sufficiently strong team to implement the proposal. A good mix of capable people with sufficient experience is present in the team.

Again, It is hard to find the experience of your developers but hopefully everyone critiquing your proposal finds it. 

The only issue I have with your experience is that it's not easily proven - you have a web site but in order to see more of the functionality, you need to sign up and get access... I did not get access but I gave you 5 stars, again, based on your overall proposal and some of the screenshots I saw in your documentation. 

In the future, you really should make it easier to check the technical abilities of the team.
More information needs to be provided as to haw this proposal addresses the challenge. It seems focused on entrepreneurs trying to scale up a business.
assessments.reply: In the development of the proposal it has been clarified in which points of the challenge works, in fact it is specified in the attached documents and you can see it in real time on the discord channel, for which we consider that we fit perfectly with the purposes of the fund. We help entrepreneurs and developers to adopt blockchain technology, specifically that of cardano.

assessments.note: A project roadmap, timeline and goals are provided.
Very hard to be convinced with this much requested funding
assessments.reply:
I do not see any objective criticism to receive such a rating, is there any metric or rule that prohibits requesting such an amount of funds?
Furthermore, the amount of funds requested is broken down in the budget breakdown of the attached documents, it is specified for which every cent will be used, even having a work team charging less than what any DEV would charge in a freelancer job. It is a platform with around 3000 hours of development.

assessments.note: The progress is auditable. A clear plan in the business proposal and the financing model for a long term with 2.5 percent fees seem reasonable and achievable. The success of the proposal is measurable based on the number of proposals listed and the number of proposals getting the fund.

This was an easy 5 stars. You provided almost all (no challenges) of the information we are looking for. You get five stars from me because, although you are missing challenges, you went above and beyond on the rest of the information.

You did a great job with this proposal itself, and with the project in general. I hope you do well in the voting

solution: Innovatio can be a commercial complement of Catalyst organized to help 100s & 1000s of proposal seeking funds.
experience: 8 Teamwork with knowledge of De-Fi Development, Business, Tech, Design, Marketing. (AWS, Cyber-security, Ts, React, Node and Deno) See bios.
